intro: Notholirion koeiei, commonly known as the coastal lily, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer, typically from July to September. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves that are adapted to withstand salty sea winds and arid conditions. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. Notholirion koeiei is a perennial species that plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes.
